name: places/ChIJPRAc6XVZwokRKq_w7wd34TA
formattedAddress: 409 E 14th St G, New York, NY 10009, USA
adrFormatAddress: 409 E 14th St G, New York, NY 10009-2706, USA

originalText.text: With your reviews about the reception, you are lowering the rating of a good doctor. I had an appointment with the doctor a week ago and all the staff in this office were very polite and friendly. I can’t complain about it

text.text: With your reviews about the reception, you are lowering the rating of a good doctor. I had an appointment with the doctor a week ago and all the staff in this office were very polite and friendly. I can’t complain about it

originalText.text:
I went to Ilan the dentist for the first time several months ago to do routine cleaning, because his clinic accepted my health insurance. The process was completed fast - it almost felt as if teeth/steps were skipped – but I thought “whatever” and dismissed this warning sign.
Well, a month later I felt a tooth sensitivity, returned to that clinic, and mr. Ilan suggested (after taking an xray) that a side-filling may help, so we did it. The local anesthetic was terrible, he may have missed or something because the injection itself not only felt very painful, but it barely numbed the area (and my mouth was swollen for a full day later) – the procedure caused extreme (!) and unreasonable pain. After paying (reception charged extra if you don't pay using their preferred method, i.e. cash), I soon learned this this procedure was pointless.
Less than a week after this very quick filling, the pain/sensitivity in that tooth increased dramatically, and got the the point I couldn’t eat/drink around it. I told the dentist about it, he wouldn’t listen - in general he just doesn’t let the other person finish their sentences as was the case in my previous visits too. Unfortunately, I ended up getting a root canal elsewhere recently in order to fix that tooth issue.
I wanted to share with others this experience, which I thought deserves one or two star review, eventually letting the latter pass, assuming good intention, but it’s a stretch: Overall, this whole dental experience was very unpleasant, unprofessional, and more costly than expected.

originalText.text: My family and I have been going to Dr Paul Ilan for years! We go to the 14th Street location and then my son followed him to Queens! Always such a pleasure to go there with a nice calm environment! would recommend for sure!

text.text: My family and I have been going to Dr Paul Ilan for years! We go to the 14th Street location and then my son followed him to Queens! Always such a pleasure to go there with a nice calm environment! would recommend for sure!

originalText.text: I had a 4 pm appointment today. I arrived at 345 and the receptionist wordlessly handed me a clipboard with paperwork to fill out. Among those documents was a form that I was expected to sign verifying that I had received Dr. Ilan's privacy agreement. I had received no such thing, so I didn't sign it. At 4:23 I asked the receptionist when I might be seen. She responded to me like I was a nuisance and told me 8 minutes. I sat again and waited another 20 minutes before approaching her again to inquire about the penalty for leaving. She cut me off mid sentence seeming irate and annoyed. I tried explaining that she could have offered some kind of transparency to waiting patients, since we were well over our scheduled times, and pointed out that even in her conversation with me, her tone and body language made me feel like my presence was a bother. She made no apology, she just said "OK" and glared at me so I left without ever having seen the dentist. I do not recommend this place if you want to be treated with kindness.

originalText.text: DPI has been best the absolutely best experience at the  dentist i have had last period of time. The stuff is very friendly  and accommodating to busy schedules. DR. Paul was very polite,friendly and gave  an honest and fair assessment of my dental work options. Highly recommend!
